Reviews.Title: Good basic phone for the price. Not without blemishes.
Reviews.Author: S. Kurbanov "sean.ferg"
Reviews.Content: I bought this phone as a replacement for my Nokia E51 business smartphone. I know this choice sounds odd. I just accidentally dropped my E51 in water and needed an inexpensive phone I can use before I can get a free upgrade from AT&T.;This phone is slim and build quality is good for the price. As for the low call/speakerphone volume, you can actually increase it (and it gets really loud). I assigned the "volume" function to one of the keys (Settings > My Shortcuts) and now can adjust the volume (even while you talk). Reception is above average.What's not so good about this phone is its grainy low resolution low color depth screen. It reminds me of one of the first phones I had back in the early 2000s. And of course, its basic functionality and lack of many features. However, if you need a phone to make/receive calls, this little phone is right for you.UPDATE!!!! There is another thing about this phone that annoys me much - you'll get a lot of dust and other particles between the screen and screen cover. Considering the screen is already far from being perfect, this makes it just the worst phone screen ever. Giving it two stars not four.

Reviews.Title: Value for the Money!
Reviews.Author: Ford Ka
Reviews.Content: This is my absolute favorite! It is slim and light, fits in any pocket (jacket or jeans), and the battery is enough for a week (if you don't talk all the time, naturally).However, I use it mainly to take calls and I don't use any functions apart from calling and txt messages. It allegedly has a radio and camera but I have never tried to use either and I don't think I ever will. You can browse the internet with it but although the screen is fairly big and bright I would not recommend it too seriously unless you need a weather forecast or currency exchange rates. It does have games as well but if you're choosing your mobile to play games, how 'bout getting a life?Very decent materials, after three months of using not a trace of wear and tear. Nokia software is a league of its own but then if you had one Nokia you move on to the next and you don't look at others. And you don't need anyone trying to convince you how good it is. I have always asked for the cheapest Nokia there was and I have never complained.This is a phone for adults - you won't impress anyone with it. If you think your sex appeal needs some accessorizing, you may not find this one your perfect choice. In other words - if you need a phone, it is the perfect choice. If you need a lot of other stuff as well, it probably is not.

Reviews.Title: Great Basic Phone
Reviews.Author: Thomas M. Carter
Reviews.Content: This is a great phone. Reception is very good. The screen is great, and it is easy to see in direct sun. It is small and light and the buttons are easy to use. The battery lasts for nearly a week.

Reviews.Title: Great little phone
Reviews.Author: AKov
Reviews.Content: This is a great little phone for the price.  I would absolutely recommend it to anyone looking for a stylish, lightweight cell phone with basic capabilities (I only use it for sms and calls) and who want great battery life to boot.Pros:1. light weight2. small enough (and slim enough) to fit comfortably in your pocket without creating a bulge3. the menu is very easy to use and intuitive4. fantastic battery life (seems to last forever)5. comes with free handsfree unit (plugs into side of phone)Cons:1. Not very loud earpiece (can be a little tough to hear when you're in a loud environment)2. when clicking through the menus at a rapid pace, I notice that I sometimes have to slow down and wait for the phone to react to the selection I've made (the lag isn't really bad, but it can be a little annoying)

Reviews.Title: Returned after day 1 use
Reviews.Author: Mac Waran
Reviews.Content: I can't believe Nokia made such a useless product 2630 model (in comparison to Nokia 6126). This was supposed to be my secondary basic phone, but so disappointing -1) The call volume is too low2) Loud Speaker (handsfree) volume is also quite low.3) Bluetooth range is less4) Frequent disconnection from laptop connection (bluetooth sync)5) During the call, when the device syncs, it is not an easy task to get back to call options6) No easy option to turn off the radio. You have to navigate to the menu to turn it off.7) When you look at the picture, you will notice two ear pieces (buds), but that's not what in the box.I will not recommend this product.

Reviews.Title: Fine for basic phone, super lightweight
Reviews.Author: J. Haynes
Reviews.Content: What I like about the phone: It is very slim and lightweight and doesn't make a large bulge in my pocket like my last phone.  I sometimes forget that it's even in my pocket.  The design is nice and stylish too.What I don't like about the phone: The phone is slow when navigating thru menus.  It also creates a long (1 second) tone whenever the first button is pushed when making a call or when already in a call.  I think this is due to the same reason that makes it slow to navigate.  It's like it gets hung up on a command for a short time.  It could use a faster processor or whatever it is that cell phones use.  It's more annoying than anything, and cuts out the audio when the 1 second tone is sounding.  i actually sent back the first one beacuse of this, but the replacement still did the same thing.The phone is simple and just does the basics.  The screen is color, but not as high resolution as some fancier phones.  But that's all I need right now so it works ok for me.  I haven't had any problems with volume like other reviewers, it's loud enough for me.

Reviews.Title: The way to go
Reviews.Author: Dave
Reviews.Content: The Nokia 2630 is a good practical phone with a useful camera and speakerphone.  There's nothing more useful than a speakerphone when waiting on hold.  The FM radio is an added benefit although it requires that you have earphones handy in your pocket or purse.I threw away my free flip-phone from the provider (actually I stashed it in a drawer) and shopped for a phone with the features I wanted.  Buying an unlocked phone is a lot cheaper than upgrading from my service provider.The Nokia 2630 is really thin making it great for a pocket phone.  The best part is that it has no side buttons to accidentally push that hang-up on the caller when you reach in your pocket to get the phone.  The sound quality could be a little better especially in noisy environments but I haven't found that to be a major problem.  All in all I am quite satisfied.

Reviews.Title: Exactly as promised
Reviews.Author: S. Barnes
Reviews.Content: This phone works just like it says it does.  It's a good, simple, reliable phone with minimal bells and whistles.  The battery lasts, the interface is quick and intuitive, and it's well designed hardware.The only issue I've noticed so far is that the volume control is difficult to find.  Aside from this, it's been great.  Once I found it, it's been no problem.

Reviews.Title: Solid, basic phone w/ great battery life
Reviews.Author: A. Fabbri "afabbri"
Reviews.Content: This little phone is good at being a phone.  You need to figure out how to control the volume during calls (see manual), and then the volume and audio quality is very good.  The camera is very basic but works well enough.  The device is very thin and light yet has a great battery life.

Reviews.Title: the suprise tecnology
Reviews.Author: Teodoro Valentin
Reviews.Content: the nokia 2630 is super. the tecnology is 3G, is practical, very light and my friends love it. it's the best thing i purchase in a long, long time. 1 to 10 i give 100.

Reviews.Title: Nokia 2630
Reviews.Author: Leslie J. Ruocchio "Budget Betty"
Reviews.Content: This was a great phone for someone who just wants a plain phone to have w/o all the bells and whistles.  However, the buttons are small, and the volume could be louder, especially for older people, as myself.Overall thou, Nokia is a great company, just wish the buttons could've been a bit bigger, and the volume control.  Actual screen is really small too!  Again, great phone for a young kid, getting their first phone, the one where the kids can call up just to tell Mom where they're at!And Thank You Amazon for being such a great company!

Reviews.Title: Excellent bluetooth phone
Reviews.Author: 3Case "3Case"
Reviews.Content: I bought this unlocked phone because finding a wired headset for my 2610 is now near impossible and AT&T; says I must wait a year+ to get a replacement from them.  Quality of calls was average using the phone by itself or with a wire headset.  Once I paired this phone with a Plantronics bluetooth headset, it's true strength showed through.  Great quality calls in both directions.  People I talk with say it does not sound like I am on a cell phone.

Reviews.Title: Excellent basic cell phone
Reviews.Author: John
Reviews.Content: If you are in the market for a "keep it simple" cell phone, the Nokia 2630 is an excellent choice. The "candy bar" slim and sleek design is very user friendly, and after a couple weeks of putting the phone through basic usage,IMO,you can not go wrong with purchasing the Nokia 2630. Amazon.com has a great price on it, too.

Reviews.Title: Excellent!!!
Reviews.Author: Oscar Hernandez V
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a simple, but with all that you need now a days, hare you have it. Is perfect, small, slime, cheap, good appearance, easy to use.JUST THE BASIC, no more, no less. If is just to call, sms, and some pictures is great!

Reviews.Title: Nokia 2630 review
Reviews.Author: Calvert Harrison
Reviews.Content: This is a very good value for your money. I love the slim built and compared to the higher end phones there is not much difference as it relates to features.Gallery storage space could have been more but with that price I cant ask for much more.The FM radio is very handy although it would have been nice if the radio could work without the earphones.My coworker has a higher end nokia but she loves mine but I love it more.Lovely phone.

Reviews.Title: Not a usable phone
Reviews.Author: Jimmy "noo_name"
Reviews.Content: Now I kick myself for not paying attention to one of previous reviews. This phone is not usable.I had several other Nokia phones. Most of them are reliable. That was the main reason I decided to get another one. However this 2630 surprised me. I can't hear anyone talking over phone. Volume is extremely low if speaker off. I had to turn speaker on and put the phone next to my ear to have any conversation. This is already after I turned volume to maximum. Bluetooth volume is OK but it drops call from time to time, about every 5-10 minutes in my case.Other than volume, the phone looks pretty sleek and camera resolution is not great but ok. Given this phone can not perform even basic functions, I'd definitely recommend against this phone.Pros:- Sleek look, light-weightCons:- Can't make phone calls without speaker on- Bluetooth drops connections all the time

Reviews.Title: Okay phone for basic talking
Reviews.Author: C. Cheshier "chessucat"
Reviews.Content: This work okay with AT&T; PAYG service.  The battery life is not as good as my old Nokia 6010, but I don't talk more than an hour and a half on rare occasions.  The Nokia 2630 did freeze up on me one time after I talked for an hour and half and the phone had the keyguard turned on.  I had to remove the battery to reboot it.  The number keys are little too close together and I have mistyped a few numbers.  I'm having problems using the web service, when I entered a url address into the Goto web address text field, it give me a Stop! error and said I need to subscribe to packet data first.  I was able to go to web some websites on my old phone.  The phone is really thin, about half of the 6010, and there is not rubber cover over the headphone, service port, and charger port on the side of phone, definitely not waterproof.  The audio is very clear and it gets good receptions.  Menu navigation is a bit tedious, but you can change the navigation keys around and change the Menu to List mode, instead of Grid.

Reviews.Title: cute, but not outside of the US
Reviews.Author: Yadid Luria "Jayl"
Reviews.Content: i got it so i could use it out of the states, but it couldn't find a network. maybe it's possible to reprogram, but when I buy an unlocked phone, it needs to be ready to use.

Reviews.Title: This phone broke my Nokia addiction
Reviews.Author: Kengineer
Reviews.Content: I would hesitate to gave this phone any stars. There is really nothing good to say about any aspect of this phone beyond its compact size.I bought this phone about a year ago after a lot of research. I pretty much looked at Nokia exclusively, because of great prior experiences with Nokia products. I did not want a smart phone for a number of reasons (battery life and large size being the two largest reasons). Unfortunately, this ended up being the worst phone I've ever owned, and it started on day one. First thing I noticed about this phone right out of the box was the half-second to second delay when pressing a button from the home screen. This got annoying fast, as it would pause with an extended beep on the first number when dialing or navigating an audio menu. That was the first sign that the processor and hardware could not handle the demands of the software or memory. It takes a good 30 seconds to a minute between when you hit send on a txt message to when the "sending" icon would disappear. It takes about 30 seconds to open the apps/games menus, and another 15 secs to 1½ mins to open the app/game (depending on its size). It has a very hard time multi-tasking, even with simple tasks. If you open a new txt while another one is sending, the phone will freeze briefly a few times until the outgoing message has been sent (which will take twice as long as normal). The phone does not delete old txt messages, so as they pile up in your inbox/sent folders, the phone takes longer and longer to open those folders. At one point, I had 2500 txt messages in the folder and it took the phone about a minute to open or update the folder (which you have to do a lot to view messages). Another annoying aspect of having too many txt message in memory was when you turn on the phone. It will not let you use messaging (view or create new) until it was ready. It would say that text messaging is not ready yet. It would take anywhere between 30 mins to an hr and a half for the txt messages to become available each time you turn on the phone.So everything I've mentioned so far relates to the inadequate hardware and the clunky software. But theres SO much more wrong with this phone than just that. The call quality is terrible. Unless your in a completely quiet environment, it is difficult to understand each other. I get complaints all the time by people I'm on the phone with that the quality sucks. The speaker phone is even worse. The speaker is poor quality, and nobody can understand anything I say when on speaker phone. In fact, unless I'm speaking within 2 inches of the mic, nobody can even hear me. Calls get dropped every now and then, but that is likely due in large part to the provider (AT&T;) than the phone. Whats even more frustrating than a dropped call is a call that I never received. I've found that quite often, somebody will call my phone, it will ring on their side until my voicemail picks up, but I will never see the call. It just simply wont ring on my end. I will suddenly get a new voice message with no missed calls while stationary with full coverage. I don't know how often this happens, since I only know about it if the caller leaves a message or tells me that they called, but I've found that it happens at least a few times a week.But wait, it gets worse. So I've had it now for about a year, and over that time, I accumulated enough contacts, photos, games, and txt messages to exceed the 11MB of storage space that this phone has. The phone gave me no warning of the approaching limit, and whats worse, it had no precaution for preventing me from exceeding it. My presumption is that when I exceeded the memory (which I did), the phone began deleting system files that were required for the phone's OS. All of a sudden, my phone started acting on its own. It would activate the camera inside of my pocket and start taking pictures and videos (switching between modes at will) and saving them to my phone. While doing this, no buttons I pressed would do anything. When a call came in, I could see it pop up on the screen and who it was, but I couldn't answer it. The phone would work normally when I turn it on until the txt messages were finally ready (which I mentioned earlier). I don't know if this is a direct cause of exceeding the phone's memory, but this should not happen either way.As bad as all of this sounds, there are many many more issues that I have with this phone. These are just the major ones. I finally decided to ditch this phone (since I finally had no choice when it stopped working as a phone) and gave into buying a smartphone. I bought the HTC Aria. I chose it in part because I like small phones, and the Aria is the smallest smartphone that I've seen (very close to the size of the Nokia 2630). I've had it for a week now and it makes me wonder why I kept my Nokia so long. Its like day and night. I should have made the upgrade long ago. Save yourself some money and frustration and DON'T BUY THE NOKIA 2630.

Reviews.Title: Nokia 2630 cell phone
Reviews.Author: Mary E. Maclean "msmac"
Reviews.Content: All I want in a phone is that it makes calls that it can text, and that it have bluetooth. I take about two pictures a year, so the camera isn't very important to me. I liked that this was little and feel it's a little fragile so I have to be careful, but I really don't like the flip phones. I was really glad to know about the shortcut to make a button to raise & lower the volume. Over all it's a fine phone. I am happy with it.

Reviews.Title: Good basic phone
Reviews.Author: Mitchel
Reviews.Content: nokia 2630 is good basic phone, with limited features and the devices is thin. I like the style of this model and great battery life

Reviews.Title: Nokia 2630
Reviews.Author: I. Fan
Reviews.Content: The Nokia 2630 phone is light and thin. It has the basic necessary features I look for. The only complaint I have is the lack of volume control or calls.

Reviews.Title: The Cellphone was not unlocked
Reviews.Author: Oscar Pereira Rojas
Reviews.Content: The cellphone it self is in good condition , but it was supposed to be unlocked and it was not, I had to pay extra money to get it unlocked, also I was not able to find a place in Amazon where I can tell this to the seller until now and it is too late to ask for my money, even so, I would have to pay a new shipping which I shouldn't since I didn't get the expected produce since the beggining, it is really desapointing.

Reviews.Title: Does NOT have email
Reviews.Author: A Customer "customer12345657"
Reviews.Content: Both Amazon's product description AND the Nokia website say that this phone has pop3, etc, email.  Amazon's description mentions it several times.It does not.  The manual does not mention it, and it is obviously not present on the phone.I returned it immediately, and did not spend much time with other features.  The display is brighter than the older Nokia 2610, although scan lines are occasionally visible.  The menu speed is also slightly improved from the 2610, although still slower than any of the low-price Ericsson models.

Reviews.Title: Nokia Cel-Phone
Reviews.Author: Jose V. Llovera "Jose V. Llovera"
Reviews.Content: Smart, friendly, allways with the Nokia Menu and nices tones, good price, received in few days with 2 amazon shipping.

Reviews.Title: Good!
Reviews.Author: Fran
Reviews.Content: Nice and convenient phone. Since it's unlocked, works with our family plan.Good price too!
